kubeconfig_instructions.after: To connect to your cluster, run: export KUBECONFIG=../kubeconfig-master.conf

kubeconfig_instructions.value: To connect to your cluster, run: export KUBECONFIG=../kubeconfig-master.conf

expression.constant_value: To connect to your cluster, run: export KUBECONFIG=../kubeconfig-master.conf

kubeconfig_instructions.description: Instructions to configure kubectl on your local machine.

master_public_ip.description: Public IP of the Kubernetes Master node.

nfs_private_ip.description: The private IP address of the NFS server

nfs_public_ip.description: The public IP address of the NFS server

description.constant_value: Combined policy for ECR, VPC CNI, and AWS Load Balancer Controller

cluster_name.description: The name of the Kubernetes cluster.

master_public_ip.description: The public IP address of the Kubernetes master node.

constant_value: timeout 800 bash -c 'while ! sudo /usr/bin/kubectl --kubeconfig=/etc/kubernetes/admin.conf get nodes >/dev/null 2>&1; do sleep 10; done'

ami_id.description: The AMI ID for the EC2 instances.

ansible_user.description: The SSH user for the AMI (e.g., 'ubuntu' for Ubuntu AMIs).

cluster_name.description: The name of the Kubernetes cluster.

ecr_repository_url.description: The URL of the ECR repository for the Docker images.

instance_profile_name.description: The name of the IAM instance profile to attach to the instance.

instance_type.description: The instance type for the master node.

key_name.description: The name of the SSH key pair to use.

nfs_server_dns.description: The DNS name of the NFS server.

private_key_path.description: Path to the private key file for SSH access.

region.description: The AWS region to deploy the resources in.

security_group_id.description: The ID of the security group for the master node.

subnet_id.description: The ID of the subnet to launch the master node in.

nfs_dns_name.description: Public DNS name of the NFS server

nfs_private_ip.description: Private IP of the NFS server (use this inside the same VPC)

nfs_public_ip.description: Public IP of the NFS server (use with caution)

static_dns_name.description: The static DNS name for the NFS server

ami.description: AMI ID for the NFS server

aws_key_name.description: value of the AWS key pair to use for the NFS server

instance_type.description: Instance type for the NFS server

subnet_ids.description: List of subnet IDs for the NFS server

vpc_id.description: VPC ID where the NFS server will be deployed

master_sg_id.description: The ID of the security group for master nodes.

public_subnet_ids.description: A list of public subnet IDs.

vpc_id.description: The ID of the created VPC.

worker_sg_id.description: The ID of the security group for worker nodes.

description.constant_value: Security group for Kubernetes Master nodes
Security group for Kubernetes Worker nodes

cluster_name.description: The name of the Kubernetes cluster.

public_subnet_cidrs.description: A list of CIDR blocks for public subnets.

vpc_cidr_block.description: The CIDR block for the VPC.

worker_public_ips.description: The public IP addresses of the Kubernetes worker nodes. This is dynamic.

aws_region.description: The AWS region to deploy resources in.

cluster_name.description: The name of the Kubernetes Cluster.

desired_capacity.description: The desired number of worker CPUs in the Kubernetes cluster.

k8s_namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace where resources will be created.

master_instance_type.description: The EC2 instance type for the Kubernetes master node.

max_worker_cpu_count.description: The maximum number of worker CPUs in the Kubernetes cluster.

min_worker_cpu_count.description: The minimum number of worker CPUs in the Kubernetes cluster.

ssh_user.description: The SSH user for the chosen AMI (e.g., 'ubuntu' for Ubuntu, 'ec2-user' for Amazon Linux).

worker_instance_type.description: The EC2 instance type for the Kubernetes worker nodes.
